div.p:
Schools are closed
through the end of
the school year.

Learn more about distance
learning at polkschoolsfl.com/icp.

School meals provided
Mon., Wed., Fri.
View updated locations list: polkschoolsfl.com/lunchlocations.

State Call Center (24/7): 866-779-6121
Polk Office (M-F, 8a.m. - 5p.m.): 863-519-7911

div.div: Be sure to subscribe to our channel to stay up to date with the latest videos being added.

div.p: We’re a B district for the second year in a row!

img.style: display: inline-block; max-width: 100%; width: auto;height: auto;

div.p: When we focus on our goals and what makes us happy is when we find true success.

img.style: display: inline-block; max-width: 100%; width: auto;height: auto;

div.p: Never stop reaching for those dreams and never quit dreaming, the only way to fail in life is to stop trying. As soon as we stop trying, we stop learning, we stop improving ourselves, and we stagnate.

img.style: display: inline-block; max-width: 100%; width: auto;height: auto;

div.h5: Valedictorian, George W. Jenkins High School

div.p: Do not lower your standards because of the circumstances, do not quit because you are tired of fighting, and do not aimlessly agree with the system because that is what you have been trained to do.

img.style: display: inline-block; max-width: 100%; width: auto;height: auto;

div.h5: Valedictorian, Harrison School for the Arts

div.p: "To face our risks head-on, we have to be able to accept any outcome. Fulfillment is found in taking risks and knowing that you gave it everything. There is no wrong answer for the future as long as we are confident and committed to our choices."

img.alt: Gov. Ron DeSantis has announced that all Florida school districts will keep their schools closed for the rest of the school year due to the coronavirus. Accordingly, the campuses of Polk County Public Schools will remain closed for the rest of the school year. Students will continue distance learning through the end of the school year. We will continue to provide meals at our food distribution sites. For a complete list of food locations and other details, please visit polkschoolsfl.com/lunchlocations. We know that the decision to close schools has significant impact on our students, employees, families, and the entire community. However, this decision is necessary to ensure the safety and well-being of everyone. Thank you for understanding. We will provide updates as additional information becomes available. #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #coronavirus

PCPS high schools lit up their athletic fields on Thursday night as part of the national “Be the Light” campaign, which honors the graduating class of 2020. At each location, the lights came on for approximately 20 minutes at 8:20 p.m. (20:20 military time). PCPS employees, families and community members showed their support by visiting some of the stadiums and honking their horns from the road. “Our high school seniors more than deserve this tribute, given the absence of so many important activities during our current national crisis,” said Dan Talbot, athletics director for PCPS. “We want this to be a message of hope, and we want all students to know they are constantly on our minds and in our hearts. Let’s light the sky and 'Be the Light' we all need to get through this.” #lovepolkschools #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #bethelight #classof2020

This heartfelt display lit up the field at Lakeland High’s Bryant Stadium on Wednesday night. It’s a show of support for the employees working to fight the coronavirus at Lakeland Regional Health, which overlooks the stadium. The person largely responsible for this display also helped create the Dreadnaught Wave, a tradition that celebrates a special bond between LHS and Lakeland Regional. Read the full story in the News section on our website (link in profile). @lakelandregionalhealth @lhsnaughtsprincipal #lovepolkschools #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #lakeland #lakelandflorida #lakelandfl #coronavirus

Congratulations to the top winners from “Our Finest,” an exhibition of the best work from Polk County’s high school student artists. Although the Polk Museum of Art is temporarily closed, the exhibition is being showcased on PMoA’s website. The highest honors were awarded to (pictured here, in order) Elizabeth Summers from Ridge Community High, Shaun Morgan from Harrison School for the Arts, Alison McNeely from Kathleen High, and Grace Knox from HSA. Read more in the News section on our website (link in profile). @ridgecommunityhigh.official @khsreddevils @harrisonartsfl @polkmuseumofart #lovepolkschools #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #lakeland #lakelandflorida #lakelandfl #davenport #davenportfl

Like all PCPS schools, Spessard Holland Elementary is closed to students, but according to employees, it's still a lively place: “The cardinals are back with a new nest in the archway of jasmine, singing a tune. While working (Tuesday), their song could be heard with a clear chirp-chirp-chirp.” #lovepolkschools #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #bartow

And now, an important message from Karie Smith's kindergarten class at Valleyview Elementary. #lovepolkschools #polkcounty #polkcountyschools #polkschools #lakeland #lakelandflorida #lakelandfl #coronavirus
